register.description: Used to program the required seconds value of the current time. Seconds are stored in BCD format, the decimal numbers are encoded with their binary equivalent. That is, if seconds value is 45, then SEC0 = 5 and SEC1 = 4.

bitfield.description: Second digit of seconds. Range is 0 to 5
First digit of seconds. Range is 0 to 9

register.description: Used to program the required minutes value of the current time. Minutes are stored in BCD format, the decimal numbers are encoded with their binary equivalent. That is, if minutes value is 32, then MIN0 = 2 and MIN1 = 3.

bitfield.description: Second digit of minutes Range is 0 to 5
First digit of minutes Range is 0 to 9

register.description: Used to program the hours value of the current time. Hours are stored in BCD format, the decimal numbers are encoded with their binary equivalent. That is, if hour is 18, then HOUR0 = 8 and HOUR1 = 1.

bitfield.description: Only used in PM_AM mode (otherwise 0) 0 = AM 1 = PM
Second digit of hours Range is 0 to 2
First digit of hours Range is 0 to 9

register.description: Used to program the day of the month value of the current date. Days are stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent. If the day value of the date is 28, DAY0 is set as 8 and DAY1 is set as 2.

bitfield.description: Second digit of days Range from 0 to 3
First digit of days Range from 0 to 9

register.description: MONTHS_REG is used to set the month in the year value of the current date. Months are stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent.

bitfield.description: Second digit of months Range from 0 to 1
First digit of months Range from 0 to 9

register.description: YEARS_REG is used to program the year value of the current date. The year value is represented by only the last two digits and is stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent. The year 1979 is programmed as 79 with YEAR0 set as 9 and YEAR1 set as 7.

bitfield.description: Second digit of Years Range from 0 to 9
First digit of Years Range from 0 to 9

register.description: WEEKS_REG is used to program the day of the week value of the current date. The day of the week is stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent.

bitfield.description: First digit of Days in a week Range from 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday)

register.description: ALARM_SECONDS_REG is used to program the seconds value for the alarm interrupt. Seconds are stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent.

bitfield.description: Second digit of seconds Range is 0 to 5
First digit of seconds Range is 0 to 9

register.description: ALARM_MINUTES_REG is used to program the minute value for the alarm interrupt. Minutes are stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent.

bitfield.description: Second digit of minutes Range is 0 to 5
First digit of minutes Range is 0 to 9

register.description: ALARM_HOURS_REG is used to program the hour value for the alarm interrupt. Hours are stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent.

bitfield.description: Only used in PM_AM mode (otherwise 0) 0 = AM 1 = PM
Second digit of hours. Range is 0 to 2
First digit of hours. Range is 0 to 9

register.description: ALARM_DAYS_REG is used to program the day of the month value for the alarm interrupt. Days are stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent.

bitfield.description: Second digit for days. Range from 0 to 3
First digit for days. Range from 0 to 9

register.description: ALARM_MONTHS_REG is used to program the month in the year value for the alarm interrupt. The month is stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent

bitfield.description: Second digit of months. Range from 0 to 1
First digit of months. Range from 0 to 9

register.description: ALARM_YEARS_REG is used to program the year for the alarm interrupt. Only the last two digits are used to represent the year and is stored as BCD format. In BCD format, the decimal numbers 0 through 9 are encoded with their binary equivalent

bitfield.description: Second digit of years. Range from 0 to 9
First digit of years. Range from 0 to 9

register.description: CTRL_REG contains the controls to enable/disable RTC.

bitfield.description: 0: RTC enable 1: RTC disable (no 32-kHz clock)
0: No action 1: Set the 32-kHz counter with comp_reg value
0: Functional mode 1: Test mode (Auto compensation is enabled when the 32-kHz counter reaches its end.)
0: 24-hour mode 1: 12-hour mode (PM-AM mode)
0: No auto compensation 1: Auto compensation enabled
0: No update 1: When a 1 is written, the time is rounded to the closest minute.
0: RTC is frozen. 1: RTC is running.

register.description: RTC STATUS_REG contains bits that signal the status of interrupts, events to the processor. Status for the alarm interrupt and timer events are notified by the register.

bitfield.description: Indicates that an alarm2 interrupt has been generated. Software must wait 31 µs before it clears this status to allow PMIC_PWR_ENABLE 1 - 0 transmission.
Indicates that an alarm interrupt has been generated. Writing 1 to the bit clears the interrupt.
One day has occurred.
One hour has occurred.
One minute has occurred.
One second has occurred.
0: RTC is frozen. 1: RTC is running.
0: Updating event in more than 15 µs. 1: Updating event. This bit will give the status of RTC module. The time and alarm registers can be modified only when this bit is 0.

register.description: INTERRUPTS_REG is used to enable or disable RTC from generating interrupts. The timer interrupt and alarm interrupt can be controlled using this register.

bitfield.description: Enable one interrupt when the alarm value is reached (TC ALARM2 registers) by the TC registers
Enable one interrupt when the alarm value is reached (TC ALARM registers) by the TC registers
Enable periodic interrupt 0 = interrupt disabled 1 = interrupt enabled
Interrupt period: 0 - every second 1 - every minute 2 - every hour 3 - every day

register.description: COMP_LSB_REG is used to program the LSB value of the 32-kHz periods to be added to the 32-kHz counter every hour. This is used to compensate the oscillator drift. The COMP_LSB_REG works with the compensation (MSB) register (COMP_MSB_REG). The AUTOCOMP bit in the control register (CTRL_REG) must be enabled for compensation to OCCUR.

bitfield.description: Indicates number of 32-kHz periods to be added into the 32-kHz counter every hour.

register.description: COMP_MSB_REG is used to program the MSB value of the 32-kHz periods to be added to the 32-kHz counter every hour. This is used to compensate the oscillator drift. The COMP_MSB_REG works with the compensation (LSB) register (COMP_LSB_REG) to set the hourly oscillator compensation value. The AUTOCOMP bit in the control register (CTRL_REG) must be enabled for compensation to OCCUR.

bitfield.description: Indicates number of 32-kHz periods to be added into the 32-kHz counter every hour

register.description: OSC_REG is used to program the oscillator resistance value, and to select and enable the clock source.

bitfield.description: 32-kHz clock enable post clock mux of RTC_32K_AUX_CLK and RTC_32K_CLK.
Disable the oscillator and applies high impedance to the output. 0: Enable 1: Disabled and high impedance
32-kHz clock source select. 0: Selects internal clock source, namely RTC_32K_AUX_CLK, from PRCM. 1: Selects external clock source namely RTC_32K_CLK, from the 32-kHz Oscillator.
External feedback resistor selection. 0: Internal 1: External
Inverter size adjustment.
Inverter size adjustment.

register.description: Used to hold some required values for the RTC register.

bitfield.description: Scratch registers, available to program.

register.description: Used to hold some required values for the RTC register.

bitfield.description: Scratch registers, available to program

register.description: Used to hold some required values for the RTC register.

bitfield.description: Scratch registers, available to program.

register.description: The KICK0 register allows writing to unlock the kick0 data. To disable RTC register write protection, the value of 83E7 0B13h must be written to KICK0, followed by the value of 95A4 F1E0h written to KICK1. RTC register write protection is enabled when any value is written to KICK0

bitfield.description: Kick0 data.

register.description: Kick1 data. The KICK1 register allows writing to unlock the kick1 data and the kicker mechanism to write to other registers. To disable RTC register write protection, the value of 83E7 0B13h must be written to KICK0, followed by the value of 95A4 F1E0h written to KICK1.

bitfield.description: Kick1 data.
IP Revision
Configuration of the local target state management mode, By definition target can handle read/write transaction as long as it is out of IDLE state.

bitenum.description: Force-idle mode: local target's idle state follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests unconditionally, i.e., regardless of the IP module's internal requirements; Backup mode, for debug only.
No-idle mode: local target never enters idle state, Backup mode, for debug only.

Smart-idle mode: local target's state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements, IP module shall not generate (IRQ- or DMArequest- related) wakeup events.

Smart-idle wakeup-capable mode: local target's idle state eventually follows (acknowledges the system's idle requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements, IP module may generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events when in idle state, Mode is only relevant if the appropriate IP module 'swakeup' output(s) is (are) implemented.

bitfield.description: Wakeup generation for event Alarm 0: Wakeup disabled 1: Wakeup enable
Wakeup generation for event Timer 0: Wakeup disabled 1: Wakeup enable Timer wakeup should not get used.

register.description: ALARM2_SECONDS_REG is used to program the seconds value of the ALARM2 time

bitfield.description: Second digit of seconds Range is 0 to 5
First digit of seconds Range is 0 to 9
Second digit of minutes Range is 0 to 5
First digit of minutes Range is 0 to 9
Only used in PM_AM mode (otherwise 0) 0 = AM 1 = PM
Second digit of hours Range is 0 to 2
First digit of hours Range is 0 to 9
Second digit for days Range from 0 to 3
First digit for days Range from 0 to 9
Second digit of months Range from 0 to 1
First digit of months Range from 0 to 9
Second digit of Years Range from 0 to 9
First digit of Years Range from 0 to 9

External wakeup inputs polarity enable for Active High and Active Low 0: Disabled 1: Enabled, Active High and Active Low EXT_WAKEUP_POL_HL[0] controls ext_wakeup0; EXT_WAKEUP_POL_HL[N] controls ext_wakeup n ; Note when enabled EXT_WAKEUP_POL_HL overrides EXT_WAKEUP_POL

Power State Machine state 00 = Idle/Default 01 = Shutdown (ALARM2 and pwr_enable enable is set, note 31uS latency from ALARM2 event.) 10 = Time based wakeup (ALARM status is set) 11 = External event based wakeup (one or more bit set in EXT_WAKEUP_STATUS)

pwr_enable enable 0: Disable When Disabled, PMIC_PWR_ENABLE will always be drive 1, ON state 1: Enable When enabled: PMIC_PWR_ENABLE will be controlled by ext_wakeup 3:0 , alarm , and alarm2. ON - OFF (Turn OFF) By ALARM2 event OFF - ON (TURN ON) By ALARM event OR ext_wakeup n event

External wakeup status 0: External wakeup event has not occurred 1: External wakeup event has occurred Wrt 1 to Clear EXT_WAKEUP_STATUS[0] status of ext_wakeup0 event EXT_WAKEUP_STATUS[N] status of ext_wakeup n event. SW must clear the events before PMIC_PWR_ENABLE can go from 1 - 0.
External wakeup debounce enabled 0: Disable 1: Enable EXT_WAKEUP_DB_EN[0] controls ext_wakeup0; EXT_WAKEUP_DB_EN[N] controls ext_wakeup n ; When enabled RTL_DEBOUNCE_REG defines the debounce time.
External wakeup inputs polarity 0: Active High 1: Active Low EXT_WAKEUP_POL[0] controls ext_wakeup0; EXT_WAKEUP_POL[N] controls ext_wakeup n ;
Enable External wakeup inputs 0: Ext Wakeup disabled 1: Ext Wakeup enable EXT_WAKEUP_EN[0] controls ext_wakeup0; EXT_WAKEUP_EN[N] controls ext_wakeup n ;
Debounce time, see for details.
